meanings.sent1: The thief's actions were the basest form of dishonesty.
meanings.sent2: It is the basest act to betray a friend's trust.
meanings.sent3: Even in the basest of situations, kindness can shine through.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut through me like the basest of insults.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was of the basest nature, seeking only to harm others.

meanings.definition: Of the lowest quality or standard.
meanings.sent1: The basest materials were used in constructing the makeshift shelter.
meanings.sent2: The food served was of the basest quality, barely edible.
meanings.sent3: Despite its basest appearance, the old car still ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The basest tools can still create beautiful art in skilled hands.
meanings.sent5: The basest excuses could not justify his poor performance.
